newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day peso closes stronger on bolsa.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day peso closes stronger on bolsa.

text.p: Mexico's same-day peso closed 2.45 centavos stronger at 7.4830/7.4870 per dollar, boosted by strong foreign investment in the stock market, dealers said.
"The peso is very firm, benefitting from the inflow of capital that is headed for the bolsa," said one dealer.
The 24-hour contract was trading 1.1 centavos higher at 7.4870/7.49 while the 48-hour peso was 1.3 centavos higher at 7.49/7.4920.
The Mexican bolsa hit a new intra-day record, rising 0.60 percent or 20.68 points to 3,454.31 points.
The peso has also gained on rumors that President Ernesto Zedillo could announce measures to spur the economy during his annual state of the union address on Sunday.
"People are saying that there will be some good news and that will create more confidence among foreigners," said one dealer.
